theme: Infrastructure services for private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Third Railway Modernization Project in
            India.  The project focused on track renewal and
            modernization with the objective of improving the planning
            and execution of Indian Railways' (IR) track renewal or
            upgrading and maintenance program, enhancing the quality and
            capacity of track and thus promoting efficient train
            operation and improving IR's financial performance. The
            above project objectives were pursued by: (i)
            renewal/upgrading of track on arterial (A routes) and other
            heavy density routes; (ii) acquiring equipment for track
            relaying and maintenance; (iii) acquiring locomotives and
            wagons for transport of track material; and (iv) technical
            assistance and training. Bank performance were highly
            satisfactory. Borrower performance was satisfactory. The
            main corridors on IR have a high traffic density and some of
            them are working near full capacity, permitting little time
            for track maintenance.With a heavier track structure in
            place on main corridors and the improved quality of track
            maintenance, IR will be in a stronger position to meet the
            challenge of increasing transport demand and competition in
            road transport, as the Indian economy continues to grow at
            an expected rate of more than 5 percent per annum. This
            project has demonstrated that the mechanization of certain
            manual operations is inescapable. Indian Railways followed
            its traditional procurement procedures for project
            implementation which slowed down procurement.  The project
            monitoring must place the same emphasis on the realization
            of perceived benefits as it does on procurement and physical
            implementation. In case of projects such as track relay and
            mechanization of track maintenance, it is essential that
            costing systems, which can generate cost data for specific
            activities, be in place so that it is possible to monitor
            overall and unit costs, as well as the benefits that arise
            as a result of project implementation.
